comments.author: Jeff Maciorowski
comments.text: ??  On TrackAzure AD Integration: Added Azure Active Directory authentication, admin user management pages, and editable user roles/divisions.Admin System Tools: Built out /admin/system-tools for database stats, clearing data, and seeding test data; added supporting API routes and a fake data generator.Custom Lists & R# Project Integration: Introduced Building Lists feature (new tables, API, UI) and R# project integration with auto-import/sync, change logs, and improved dev scripts.Panel & List Details: Added detailed pages for panel members and lists (compliance history, linked projects, professional info).Dashboard Improvements: Enhanced dashboard with expiring lists, recent activity, and new API endpoints.Panel Search & Import: Advanced multi-select filters, CSV export, refactored import to support many-to-many panel/list mapping.Testing Infrastructure: Added Vitest setup, initial test suites, updated README for TDD and coverage.Infrastructure Updates: Improved Docker/compose files, navigation, and supporting UI components.

bullets: *Key highlight:** The TrackAzure AD team has successfully implemented user authentication and management features, enhancing admin capabilities with editable roles and divisions.
*Feature update:** New tools for database management have been introduced, including stats tracking, data clearing, and a fake data generator to support testing.
*Integration success:** The R# team has integrated new features such as auto-import/sync, change logs, and improved development scripts, streamlining project workflows.
*User experience enhancement:** Detailed pages for panel members now include compliance history and linked projects, alongside a dashboard displaying expiring lists and recent activity.
*Data handling improvements:** Multi-select filters and CSV export functionality have been added, with a refactored import process to support complex panel/list mappings.
issues.oneLiner: Exciting progress on centralized data tools enhances research efficiency and user management!

comments.author: Mary Seiler
comments.text: Feedback from the team:The objective is to deliver real-time, inline alerts on payment delays and issues across the entire processing lifecycle for all payments, without requiring participants to open the message icon and alter the transaction status. Historical messages can remain accessible via the History button and reflect status changes. However, when multiple updates exist, the system must display the most recent message by default, even if the transaction status is unchanged.?Option one is the most appropriate.To ensure functional coverage, can we please incorporate:?Enable message uploads directly from the Batch Information page without requiring or triggering a batch status update.?Enable bulk message upload via file import, reusing the existing ?Processing file? export file to support multiple translations.We add measures to all transactions, not only failed payments; therefore, to reduce clutter, introduce an auto-hide behaviour for payment messages. Upon a new payment request, previous messages should be hidden from the Wallet main/transactions view but remain available through the ?History? button, ensuring the user?s focus remains on the most recent transaction.Instead of the word ?History? can we use something softer in line with the wallet scheme, such as the note?s icon, accompanied by an I for ?Information?, such as ? i History?

comments.author: Evgeniy Suhov
comments.text: Thanks for sharing the feedback.The objective is to deliver real-time, inline alerts on payment delays and issues across the entire processing lifecycle for all payments, without requiring participants to open the message icon and alter the transaction status. Historical messages can remain accessible via the History button and reflect status changes. However, when multiple updates exist, the system must display the most recent message by default, even if the transaction status is unchanged.I?m a bit concerned that the new objective seems quite different from the original task description that was approved for development. Are we focusing on UI improvements for users, or does this have a broader scope?Enable message uploads directly from the Batch Information page without requiring or triggering a batch status update.Enable bulk message upload via file import, reusing the existing ?Processing file? export file to support multiple translations.We could potentially support this by adding a new entry to the transaction history - something like ?Transaction Status Update?. This entry would include new internal and member notes linked to it. Would that work? Please let us know if you had another approach in mind.We add measures to all transactions, not only failed payments; therefore, to reduce clutter, introduce an auto-hide behaviour for payment messages. Upon a new payment request, previous messages should be hidden from the Wallet main/transactions view but remain available through the ?History? button, ensuring the user?s focus remains on the most recent transaction.Member notes exist not only for payments, but also for compensations and manual corrections. Would you like us to display notes for payments only?To make it easier, we could just always display the latest note. In that case, if there is a newer payment without any notes, we would still show the note from the older payment.Instead of the word ?History? can we use something softer in line with the wallet scheme, such as the note?s icon, accompanied by an I for ?Information?, such as ? i History?Sorry, I am confused. Which word do you want us to use intead of ?History??Thank you.

comments.author: Alexis Lanas Flores
comments.text: Hi  ,Point 1  - ScopeThe original request is to display the latest message to the user; however, it isn?t functional because the system only allows messages to be added when a transaction status changes (e.g., from ?Processing' to 'Complete?). Once we batch payments, if a batch remains in the ?Processing? state, we can?t post interim updates; only when we fail or complete the batch. To meet the requirement of displaying the latest and most relevant note without changing payment logic, we should dissociate messaging from status changes: allow ?internal/external notes? to be added at any time and surface the most recent external note to the user.I understand this might seem like an extension of the original request, but since all of this is about enhancing the UI and UX, can we allow those two updates, following the ?Transaction Status Update? approach you recommend? Point 2 - ?Transaction Status Update?Yes, this could work, as adding the ?Transaction Status Update? will meet the objective.Point 3 - Member notesFor now, we can only offer the notes on corrections and payments, as we have more centralised controls and an established process. I understand what you meant by displaying only the latest note. The issue with that is, for example, sometimes participants request multiple payments through different methods, and payments may fail while another transaction is being processed. So if we have to provide updates on those two transactions, one will be missed.For now, we can expose notes only for corrections and payments, where we have centralised controls and an established process.On showing ?only the latest note?: that?s risky at the member level. Participants often have multiple concurrent payment requests via different methods; one may fail while another is still processing. If we surface a single latest note, updates for the other transaction can be hidden.Would it work if we display the latest external note for each ?active? transaction, in addition to the last payment, for 30 days (only the previous payment)?Point 4 - ?History?Using ?History? as the label is fine, but please don?t render it as plain text; users may miss that it?s a clickable item. Use the notes icon + ?History? as a clickable button in the last column to match the Wallet theme and improve discoverability.Regards, Alexis

comments.author: Evgeniy Suhov
comments.text: Hi ,Thanks for your feedback.Point 1 - ScopeIt makes sense, but I still think that the panel website UI improvements and updates to the MR system are not directly related. Member notes exist at the moment, so we can make them display next to the transaction status as originally requested in the ticket.Anyway, could you please include additional requirements to the task description? I understand that you are looking for 2 new features:Add same internal note and / or member note to all payments of the batch through the form:Add individual internal notes and member notes via the file upload:A few things to consider:I?m somewhat concerned that uploading the same file multiple times could result in duplicate notes.Should adding notes be allowed for any payment status (processing, failed, completed)?Should we allow adding an internal note without a member note? In that case, it would appear as ?Transaction Status Update? in the history, but no message would be provided.Point 3 - Member notesWould it work if we display the latest external note for each ?active? transaction, in addition to the last payment, for 30 days (only the previous payment)?Sorry, this is a bit confusing. Does this look correct?Display the latest external note for all ?active? manual corrections and payments. ?Active? means the transaction status is not Failed or Completed.Display external notes for all payments as long as the notes are no older than 30 days. Or should this only apply to the latest payment with notes?Point 4 - HistoryWe?ll update the design for the ?History? label and let you know once it?s ready for review.Thank you.

comments.author: Evgeniy Suhov
comments.text: Point 4 - HistoryWe have a couple of design suggestions for the history. I include them below together with comments from Sergey:For the first version, I use a button but change its style to 'outlined'. This will help the user interact with it as a clickable element and make it stand out among other elements in the table.For the second version, I use an icon with underlined text, which will also give the user the ability to click on 'History', thereby creating a visual hierarchy for it. The only thing is, I changed the icon to a more appropriate one, in my opinion.Please let us know if one of the versions work for you.Thank you.

comments.author: Alexis Lanas Flores
comments.text: Hi  ,I apologise, but I?m unsure how to edit the task description. What name do you suggest??Display External Notes and Notes? internal process update?Here is the feedback for the two outstanding questions. Point 1 - ScopeThe problem is that the current Notes are not providing enough insights during the payment cycle; therefore, they have become inadequate, as participants are constantly contacting us for updates during the processing phase, and it is time-consuming to prepare external dotmailer campaigns to send communications to participants. The internal update interface is necessary due to the multi-language updates, allowing for updates to be provided as quickly as possible.I understand that you are looking for two new features:Add the same internal note and / or member note to all payments of the batch through the form:Yes. Currently, we can update notes either through the Batch screen or file upload; there is no distinction between these methods. The only rule is that we must ?update the transaction status? to trigger an update in the system notes. Additionally, the issue here is that the batch upload doesn?t distinguish between record languages, and payment requests are grouped by method and currency. To simplify the process, leaving the option of batch updates to top-level updates, for example, when the whole batch belongs to a single country, which implicitly covers a single language, would be beneficial. However, when dealing with multiple countries/languages, we must use the file upload feature. A few things to consider:I?m somewhat concerned that uploading the same file multiple times could result in duplicate notes.To avoid this, I think we can have two-tier system updates:Tier 1 ?Stage? ? Transaction Stage updates happen when we update the transaction: Processing, complete, or failedTier 2 ?Status? ? Transaction Status Update: The ?Transaction Status Update? will trigger inter-transaction-stage updates. To avoid adding duplicate notes, we can leave the record as a ?Processing? status, which will skip the record.Under this approach, if we use ?Transaction Status Update? to trigger an inter-stage update (?Processing? to ?Complete?/? Failed?), to control the duplication of messages or skip a record, we can leave it as ?Processing?; otherwise, Tier 2 updates are logged when we use a ?Transaction Status Update? option. Furthermore, if we change the record from ?Processing? to ?Failed? or ?Complete?, this will be a Tier 1 update, which is already accepting messages for each update. However, we still need the file upload to handle the multilingual batches.Should adding notes be allowed for any payment status (processing, failed, completed)?Only during the ?processing? stage, as 80% of the updates will occur during this phase. Otherwise, any update on ?complete and failed? will be carried out as a tier 1 ?Transaction-stage update? following the options of batch/file updates (due to the multilingual transactions).Should we allow adding an internal note without a member note? In that case, it would appear as ?Transaction Status Update? in the history, but no message would be provided.No, Member notes must always be there, because this is a UI improvement. For internal notes, we have various controls and processes in place.Point 3 - Member notesDisplay the latest external note for all ?active? manual corrections and payments. ?Active? means the transaction status is not Failed or Completed. Correct. The ?Processing? stage should be the main active status. The issue with ?Manual Payments? is that we don?t have a processing stage; it transitions directly from ?waiting to process? to ?complete or failed?, without requiring inter-stage updates. We don't need inter-stage updates because we initiate the process when we are certain that all the necessary information is correct to process the payment. Manual correction statuses range from ?nothing to ?complete? (as they are used for adjustments) and will follow the updates explained below under ?Tier 1?. However, these updates can only be applied through file upload, as we cannot batch them and do not require an inter-stage update.Display external notes for all payments as long as the notes are no older than 30 days. Or should this only apply to the latest payment with notes?The issue we have is that in some markets, we allow multiple requests at the same time, so the conditions should be according to the transaction?s stage as follows:Processing = Active + ?Transaction Status Update? (all transaction ?Tier 2? updates will happen at this stage), always on display.Complete = Inactive + the latest message (Tier 1) for 30 days OR until a new payment request is submitted, according to the latest transaction update (Tier 2 messages won?t apply under this phase).Failed = Inactive + the latest message (Tier 1) until a new payment request is submitted (Tier 2 messages won?t apply under this phase).Please let me know if you have more questions.Thanks Alexis

Milestone goal: Mini Calculator will be built out.I?ve submitted changed for the Mockups to be made by Sergey. It?s rearranging the modules a bit to repurpose them and a lot of relabeling. Some new fields have been added/edited.The Mockups are needed after Wednesday, so if they are not back in time - we may swap some of the tasks from Sprint 2 to Sprint 1. I?ll communicate any changes in the Sprint when he get closer.I?m meeting with Mayu, Adam and Jason next week to start to talk about Phase 2 requirements so we can have those ready to go after Phase 1 has concluded.

comments.author: Katelyn Schuh
comments.text: The Mini Calculator has been created along with the corresponding popup. The value fields have been added and change based on input fields. The calculator prefills on edit and fills in the discount row on save. Restrictions have been applied to the T&C page to not allow the user to change a discount without adding a new calculator first. The Discount Request button has been added to the T&C as well.Sprint 1 ended on Wednesday and Sprint 2 was set to kick off on Thursday. We haven?t quite got through all of Sprint 1 due to changes being made to the mockups, which forced Jason to pause until they could be approved by the team. Now that we are following mockups, Jason estimates we can save some time there. 9 story points will be carried over into Sprint 2.I?ve submitted 3 final edits to be made to the mock up of the Approvals page. I?ll share them one last time before committing, but after speaking with Mayu it sounds like these changes would cover the remaining concerns.

comments.author: Katelyn Schuh
comments.text: Jason has built out the mini calculator. The discount summary has been added to the T&C page. All 3 of the request pages have been built (minus some styling items). The request form can be submitted and triggers the email notification. The logic to pull in the approvers has been completed. While the logic to hide the discount costs and set the quantity to 0 when a request is denied is almost done. We still need to implement the logic to prevent users from moving forward when not approved, and the logic to exclude certain divisions and clients.The mockups have been finalized and shared with Tom and Alex.We?ve entered week 2 of Sprint 2 and hope to wrap up development by the middle of next week so that it can be tested.? A demo will be scheduled after Sprint 2 ends. UAT to follow after. Because the majority of the more advanced work is in Phase 2, we are only running a small UAT group for Phase 1. A mix of Sales & Ops team members. Mayu has a list of interested parties.At this point, the project is on track.

comments.author: Katelyn Schuh
comments.text: Development of Phase 1 is complete. Sprint 2 went over by just 1 day. As of yesterday I have started to QA Phase 1. I have 10 bugs reported as of last night. Mayu will be providing feedback as well. Once Jason has closed any bugs and addressed any issues. We want to have a short demo this coming week with the stakeholders and UAT group with UAT to follow directly after. I hope to schedule this for mid week.Items that I need to look into: That correct approvers are appearing in dropdowns according to discount thresholds, the block on the billing page and client list requirements. I?ve changed the project to at risk due to missing the sprint deadline by a day. This pushed our schedule back 1 day as well. There is a chance to get back on track this coming week if QA keeps going well. The demo and UAT deadlines have not been finalized yet so nothing has been communicated at this point.

comments.author: Katelyn Schuh
comments.text: ?? QA has been completed and 32 issues were identified. There are 13 issues currently waiting to be tested and 9 issues have already been resolved.I?m meeting with Jason and Mayu later this morning to review any remaining pieces and prepare for the demo next week.Demo Scheduled for Tuesday   To include Tom Pugh, Sara Rhoades, Alex Boethius, & Beth Reilly as well as a group of 9 UAT testers.UAT to follow immediately, while the due date has yet to be finalizedJason had to pivot to bidding issues this week and QA took longer than planned to allow for more comprehensive testing, I?ve been working closing with Jason and Mayu and the extra time taken has allowed us to correct a hand full of issues as well as many smaller bugs that would allow for a better user experience. I think this will help with adoption as the process is a bit more streamlined. Having the work done correctly during the first phase will also make phase 2 even smoother.

comments.author: Katelyn Schuh
comments.text: ??  The Demo went well. 2 very minor bugs were displayed during the presentation and have already been addressed. 2 concerns came up regarding: the order of discounts that needs to be applied (Beth, Alex and Mayu are having conversations around this topic to come to a decision) and if PMs will remember to recalculate the discount (if the project scope changes after being applied) - Jason already has implemented a fix for this one. It was originally asked to add more alerts and warnings to the system to prevent this, so having Jason finding a way around that will leave the process less cluttered.UAT has begun. I?ve heard from a few people regarding connection issues and inviting more testers in. The tentative due date is EOD   I will follow up then and see if more time is needed. So far the log contains 3 items.

comments.author: Katelyn Schuh
comments.text: ??  UAT wrapped up on Wednesday  We had 17 items reported but with Jason?s initial fixes around recalculation - there was really only 14 that needed to be reviewed. Most of them came from Mayu.I?ve retested all of the completed items so far and Jason is looking into the last 2 issues raised.I?ve reached out to the UAT group for sign off.

comments.text: ??  1 final item came up that Jason is working on a fix for. Once that is fixed and tested, we can consider UAT completed. They?ve been informed that this can be released as early as next week.Once we have a set release date scheduled, I will inform all involved. Mayu has put together a user guide that will be distributed to teams. I?ve created a Camtasia video to coincide with this release that will be added to the Engineering Updates space. So roll out is ready at this point.

comments.text: ??  Went live with Phase 1 this morning.An issue with the removing the last minute addition of the 2.5% IQVIA discount and a bad merge from the team caused the delay. The business introduced the IQVIA discount during the last week, it was a rush to get the code updated and tested, only for the business to decide to hold off for now (added delay reasons for: Engineering Delay and Integration Issues)Jason is monitoring for any issues that arise.The discount cal and approval module is already being utilized by teams across different divisions - which is very promising.

bullets: *Key highlight:** Phase 1 of the automatic discount calculation project launched successfully, with ongoing collaboration among teams to finalize specifications and address any outstanding issues.
*Project update:** Additional tasks have been created based on revised specs, and estimates indicate an extra 99 hours of work needed, pushing the timeline into mid-[team].
*UAT progress:** User Acceptance Testing (UAT) has concluded with 17 items reported; 14 are pending review after initial fixes, and stakeholders are being contacted for final sign-off.
*Next steps:** The release date for Phase 1 is set, with a user guide and video prepared for rollout. The billing gatekeeper has been reintroduced to ensure smooth EOM billing.
issues.oneLiner: Exciting progress on automatic discount calculations brings us closer to streamlined efficiency!

comments.author: Jeff Maciorowski
comments.text: Oli and Brad had a kick-off call on Wednesday  , here is a quick summary for what Bidding 2.2 will be.  I will get Oli and Brad to verify that this is the general summary of it.  Quick discussion with Brad is about a 3-4 week estimate, he needs build out his tasks. Reordering & Copying: Enabled drag-and-drop for target groups and cost rows, and added multi-select row copying in both main and mini Quote Builder.Cloning Improvements: Unified "Clone" button with logic based on QB usage?clones with or without groups to match legacy behavior.Qual/Quant Methodologies: Streamlined methodology lists across both QB and legacy tools; now fully open and trimmed for clarity.Feasibility Factor: Applied 0.6 factoring to internal panels, aligning with existing logic for partners.Fixed Cost Update: For QualStage, fixed cost quantity now reflects the total of all group quotas.Visual Enhancements: Updated group hover color to dark blue to reduce confusion with grey (used for hidden items).

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: I am back working on this project this week. Completed email scrubbing functionality with List Certified vendor and started to work on new scalable invite worker. Also worked with IT to get new Postal instance set up. This progress makes me optimistic we can still launch it at the beginning of the summer. I?m moving target date just 2 weeks out to June 16th.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: This week mostly worked on Bulk Email invite worker and related processing jobs. All of the work I am currently focusing on is background jobs therefore the next demo is likely to be at the beginning of June.I also coordinated with Evgeniy efforts to update Contact Preference page on MPW. They target   for delivery.We have recently identified that a separate panel needs to be used for M3MI. This normally involves creating hub server and panel website which is out of scope of this project. I will try to make M3MI panel to use M3GR hub, but if not feasible that will delay the project.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: Made good progress this week. Finished invite worker and email server multi-domain website engine with unsubscribe endpoints. I am currently deploying some of the code to production and working with M3MI to trial live sample in the coming days. I am leaving some work needed for M3GR in order to get the tool out to M3MI asap to help with transition from a vendor.The work on Bulk Email for M3GR will likely slip into the next project, custom recruitment automation, but overall target should not be impacted which is still end of summer.I am off 21st-26th May. The next update is in 2 weeks, on Friday the 30th.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: I was running trial campaign for M3MI this week which while was sussesful in terms of Bulk Email tool functionality also identified 2 problems:The list provided by M3MI generates high volume of complains. I do not believe it is feasibale to send the entire list in a timely manner without getting mail server blacklisted.There is a network issue with current mail server/ISP which prevents delivering emails to all mail providers. The IT team was made aware of the problem on May 20th, unfortunately we still do not have a solution. Likely a new ISP would be needed.While onboarding M3GR and sending their higher quality lists alongside M3MI lists would help to mitigate point 1. We can?t really onboard M3GR because of point 2. Therefore the project in a grid-lock at the moment.I will keep working on remaining functionality and getting M3GR CR team familiar with the tool but the project is in high risk due to unresolved IT problems.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: This week, while waiting for IT to resolve network issues on the mail server and for the Frontend team to complete the MPW unsubscribe changes, I took the opportunity to work on other initiatives. Specifically, I focused on customer support automation options and assisted with migrating the Ruby stack to Kubernetes.I am currently working on the remaining pieces for Bulk Email, particularly adding translation tool support into Bulk Email templates.I was informed that M3MI has given notice to their vendor, so we no longer have a June deadline. Their contract should be valid until September.I cannot proceed with M3MI onboarding until I can onboard M3GR CR US, and I cannot onboard M3GR until the mail server issues are resolved and the MPW changes are complete.I will continue to do what I can and will keep updating this ticket.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: This week I had a second and likely final demo with all key stakeholders. I showed functionality, addressed questions and agreed on rollout plan.Next week, once updates to Multi-Panel Website are released, I will work with M3GR team on settng up templates and start sending campaigns for live projects. When server reaches stable volume and good deliverability I will start working with M3MI team to onboard them.Since the project has been released to production and is about to be used by the end users I am switching the project to UAT.While teams start using the tool and I work on thier feedback I will  add i18n support to allow M3GR team to send sample in non English markets.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: Updates to MPW were released yesterday. I am meeting with Panel Team today to help them to start using the tool.This week I worked on adding translate tool support into template engine of the Bulk Email and on implementing Neil?s feedback regarding excluding known deliverable emails from scrubbing among other things.I am expecting to wrap up the project within couple of weeks, subject to feedback from UAT.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: This week M3GR CR team has been onboarded and first US campaign sent. It had good deliverability, though proved that reputation of the server is still poor for any serious volume. Templates for US and UK markets are ready and the teams were unstructed to send up to 1K emails per day for each market for now.I am monitoring system?s performance and adjust logic to make sure smooth warming up process.Next week focus will likely switch to Campaign Automation project.

bullets: *Key highlight:** Progress continues on the Bulk Email Delivery project with optimistic plans for a summer launch, moving the target date to [team] 16th.
*Project update:** The team has made significant strides in developing the invite worker and email server functionalities, with successful trials and deployments in production.
*Current challenges:** Network issues with the mail server and high complaint rates from M3MI's email list pose risks to the project timeline, but efforts are ongoing to resolve these.
*Next steps:** The M3GR CR team has been onboarded, and initial campaigns have been sent with promising deliverability, although server reputation remains a concern.
*Looking ahead:** The project is transitioning to User Acceptance Testing (UAT), with plans to incorporate feedback and finalize updates in the coming weeks.
issues.oneLiner: Exciting progress on email delivery project, with successful campaigns and onboarding underway!

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: After a mail server experienced a configuration issue last Friday, I shifted my focus this week to onboarding another mail server and improving the sending logic. As a result, we now have two active mail servers with automatic, gradual spin-up to cruising volume and dynamic throughput management based on bounce rates. We are also tracking both server-level and recipient domain metrics for each mail server.The mail servers demonstrated good deliverability yesterday, which means I should be able to focus on the dashboard next week. The project remains on track for completion by the end of August.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: We are back with 3 servers online + 1 pending setup which I will work on next week.Mail servers show various deliverability performance. The best one has sub 1% bounce rate and seems to be ok with up to 10K emails per day. Hopefully we can get the rest to the same level and that will be a power house. Stuart is helping me on the mail server front.Had some progress on the CR Dashboard, will be looking to finish next week and schedule a demo for the CR team.

comments.author: Max Kuklin
comments.text: ??  This week, we had a demo of the Custom Recruitment Campaign Automation Dashboard. It was well received, with no immediate change requests. Stakeholders were informed that the project is wrapping up by the end of August and that they need to submit any changes before then.Due to continued deliverability volatility, we held a review meeting with Neil and Stuart and agreed to add four more servers into the mix. The sponsor (Neil) is now fully aware of the deliverability challenges and that the ad hoc work related to improving deliverability may continue well after the project closes.Overall, we are still optimistic that we can build enough reputation to send the required volumes for M3GR. For M3MI, we are still waiting for engagement numbers to be provided so we can plan the required volume, as the initial request to send over 200K cold emails within a few days is not feasible due to ESP industry constraints outside our control. Nevertheless, due to higher deliverability on bulk email compared to the previous vendor, we hope the required engagement (responses and completes) can be achieved with a smaller sample, which we will be able to deliver within a few months.Additionally, a new report on domain deliverability was created this week and is available in the MR System here.

comments.author: Jeff Maciorowski
comments.text: Meeting SummaryProject Overview & Goals:Neil emphasized consolidating divisional KPIs to ensure consistency and simplify access. Targeting substantial project completion by end of June, with a focus on monthly data collection and gradual data quality improvements.Data Sources & Ownership:Finance spreadsheets for GP dataHR data for headcountsExisting queries for panel data (Nazeer)Sales data (Shelby)Third-party cost data from DMR (Alan)Adam is responsible for structuring and organizing the data to avoid downstream issues.KPI Definitions & Logic:Focus metrics include revenue, GP, gross margin, panel size, revenue per headcount, etc.Adam proposed using naming conventions to distinguish actuals vs. targets.Team agreed to store both numerator and denominator values for derived KPIs to support transparent calculations.Process & Technical Setup:Emphasis on consistent file structures to enable semi-automated loading.Neil to define standardized data file format for uploads via MR system tool.Reporting Approach:Initial priority is reliable, readable data. Visual refinement to follow.Power BI will be used for dynamic, interactive reporting.Action Items[Adam] Structure and store data for stability and scalability.[Nezir] Input panel data into the new structure.[Shelby] Provide and validate the source for sales data.[Alan] Supply third-party cost data from DMR.[Team] Finalize KPI definitions with clear naming (actuals vs. targets).[Neil] Define data file format for upload; schedule review meeting for early next week.[Team] Begin sourcing and loading initial data by end of this week.[All] Review progress and structure in the next scheduled session.

comments.author: Jeff Maciorowski
comments.text: Will probably need to create a new card for Accrual BI Updates. Adam is currently working on Divisional KPI project so will need to discuss timeline due to time availability.  Here is a breakdown of what is coming.Objective: Add accruals as a new measure to revenue reporting in Power BI.Use Case: Accruals (including cross-divisional) from the previous month should be:Displayed as a new line in the reports.Deducted from future months? unaccrued revenue.Reports Impacted:Revenue Projection ReportGlobal Team Revenue ReportProfit ReportCurrent StatusAccrual functionality is now live in the MR system.Randy is building a master accrual log, to be updated monthly and serve as the primary data source for this integration.Technical Considerations1. ETL / Data Model ImpactThe request is currently ?jumping past? ETL and modeling layers.We need to define how accruals reshape the existing revenue modeling before implementing front-end changes.2. Effective Date HandlingAccruals will require modifying the effective date of certain revenue records to reflect month of accrual.This is critical for FX conversion, which is driven by effective date.Clarification is needed on whether only portions of a line will be re-dated or full lines.3. Revenue Definition AdjustmentsWe currently define multiple revenue types:TypeDescriptionQuoted RevenueProjected revenue based on quoted targetsExpected RevenueCurrently used in most reports; dynamically reflects project stageInvoiced RevenueRevenue from approved invoicesActual RevenueBooked finance revenueDescoped RevenueRemoved from scope; may blend with actualsAccrued Revenue ? NewRevenue manually recorded to reflect earned revenue ahead of invoicing; used for improving month-end reporting accuracyWe need to define:A new measure: "Accrued Revenue".Logic for how "Accrued Revenue" interacts with "Expected Revenue" and "Actual Revenue".Whether Expected Revenue should decrease in future months when accruals are recorded.Next Steps & QuestionsModeling ? Confirm how accruals will update or supplement revenue lines in the data warehouse.Effective Date ? Will it shift or create new rows for partial revenue lines?Definitions ? Finalize language for "Accrued Revenue" and its relationship to existing KPIs.ETL Changes ? Plan for extracting and transforming the accrual log Randy is building.Power BI Changes ? Once the above is settled, implement changes in model and reports.

comments.text: Go-Live: List Match 3.0 is now live in production.Performance & Accuracy: Match rates are comparable to the previous engine, with solid overall performance.Optimization Work: Adjustments underway to better manage memory usage during large fuzzy match-only runs.Post-Processing Improvements: New stored procedure for S3-to-DB loading has significantly reduced post-processing time.Next Phase: Focus will shift to enabling EU matching functionality.

bullets: *Key highlight:** The core development for the EBP-140 List Match 3.0 project is nearly complete, with teams actively configuring AWS environments to ensure scalability and reliability.

*Testing efforts:** Teams are conducting extensive testing on various match types, focusing on performance and match quality, while also implementing detailed logging for insights.
*Deployment readiness:** The production environments are set up and ready for code deployment, with an initial version expected to run next week for validation against the current tool.

*Launch success:** List Match 3.0 is now live in production, demonstrating comparable performance to the previous engine, while efforts continue to enhance memory management and enable EU matching functionality.
